entry.title: The Little Prince
entry.summary:
[February 2018 - June 2018]
Course: Introduction to Web Design

The Little Prince is an interactive story website for children aged 13 and under. The project aims to design a digital version of a printed “choose users own adventure” book. The entire website was designed through three iterations process to explore how it can most effectively translate the book from physical to digital form.
entry.content:
[February 2018 - June 2018]
Course: Introduction to Web Design

entry.title: Spoon Pets
entry.summary:
[July 2018 - November 2018]
Course: Human-Computer Interaction

“Spoon Pets” is a conceptual interaction design of an application prototype that helps users develop productivity and overcome procrastination, therefore enables them to foster ethical behaviour. The prototype was built by using Adobe suit and sketch.
entry.content:
[July 2018 - November 2018]
Course: Human-Computer Interaction

“Spoon Pets” is a conceptual interaction design of an application prototype that helps users develop productivity and overcome procrastination, therefore enables them to foster ethical behaviour. The prototype was built by using Adobe suit and sketch.

entry.title: Anxiety Eliminator Game
entry.summary:
[July 2017 - November 2017]

“Anxiety Eliminator” is an interactive&digital game prototype built by using the Unity(C#) and involve some forms of physical interaction by using the Leap Motion and MakeyMakey.
entry.content:
[July 2017 - November 2017]

“Anxiety Eliminator” is an interactive&digital game prototype built by using the Unity(C#) and involve some forms of physical interaction by using the Leap Motion and MakeyMakey.

entry.title: Super Survivor 2.5D Game
entry.summary:
[July 2018 - November 2018]
Course: Digital Prototyping

“Super Survivor Game” is a small map adventure game of website. It was built by using the The HTML5 Creation Engine(PixiJS) and involve physical interaction by using the MakeyMakey.
entry.content:
[July 2018 - November 2018]
Course: Digital Prototyping

“Super Survivor Game” is a small map adventure game of website. It was built by using the The HTML5 Creation Engine(PixiJS) and involve physical interaction by using the MakeyMakey.

entry.title: The Old Queensland
entry.summary:
[July 2017 - November 2017]
Course: Design Computing Studio 1

The Old Queensland is an interactive web application built using the State Library of Queensland. The objective of the website is allowing users to explore historical information through various interesting interactions, visualizing digital records and offering an aesthetic visual representation for users. At the meantime, this project tends to provide a better browsing and learning experience for the target customers of the website.
entry.content:
[July 2017 - November 2017]
Course: Design Computing Studio 1

The Old Queensland is an interactive web application built using the State Library of Queensland. The objective of the website is allowing users to explore historical information through various interesting interactions, visualizing digital records and offering an aesthetic visual representation for users. At the meantime, this project tends to provide a better browsing and learning experience for the target customers of the website.

entry.title: BeUpStanding
entry.summary:
[July 2018 - November 2018]
Course: Design Computing Studio 3 - Build

“BeAppStanding” is an iOS mobile application to further help the target users to sit less and stand more. This application and physical prototype were development by using native platforms (Swift,Xcode). The key component of my responsibility is to consider how to enhance the user experience and design the data visualisation by using emotion design and interface usability. In terms of it, the system can improve the cognition of target audience.
entry.content:
[July 2018 - November 2018]
Course: Design Computing Studio 3 - Build

entry.title: Familiar Stranger
entry.summary:
[July 2018 - November 2018]
Course Name: Social & Mobile Computing

“Familiar Stranger” is a design concept which try to evoke people’s self-awareness of mobile addiction. It includes a IOS mobile app prototype and a smart case which made by RFduino.
entry.content:
[July 2018 - November 2018]
Course Name: Social & Mobile Computing

“Familiar Stranger” is a design concept which try to evoke people’s self-awareness of mobile addiction. It includes a IOS mobile app prototype and a smart case which made by RFduino.

entry.title: Fluency
entry.summary:
[February 2019 - July 2019]
Course: Physical Computing

“Fluency” is a gamified experience in which users will be given a sentence on a screen with a single word missing. This is an open-end game for language beginner to learn new language by using physical object.
entry.content:
[February 2019 - July 2019]
Course: Physical Computing

“Fluency” is a gamified experience in which users will be given a sentence on a screen with a single word missing. This is an open-end game for language beginner to learn new language by using physical object.

entry.title: Standing Cushion
entry.summary:
[July 2018 - July 2019]
Master Thesis

"How to develop a Device to remind Elderly people do more activities when they sitting for long time in home?" is the research question. This thesis is meant to address these problems by analysing the required infrastructure of an Internet of Things in home, which was developed following concepts of user-centered design and usability. After the analysis, presenting a new assistive system based on Embed Interaction tech for enabling low-cost sensing on everyday objects.
entry.content:
[July 2018 - July 2019]
Master Thesis

"How to develop a Device to remind Elderly people do more activities when they sitting for long time in home?" is the research question. This thesis is meant to address these problems by analysing the required infrastructure of an Internet of Things in home, which was developed following concepts of user-centered design and usability. After the analysis, presenting a new assistive system based on Embed Interaction tech for enabling low-cost sensing on everyday objects.
